column2: GOVERN
column3: Organizational Context

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Organizational Context (GV.OC): The circumstances - mission, stakeholder expectations, and legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements - surrounding the organization's cybersecurity risk management decisions are understood (formerly ID.BE)
column5: GV.OC-01: The organizational mission is understood and informs cybersecurity risk management (formerly ID.BE-02, ID.BE-03)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Organizational Context (GV.OC): The circumstances - mission, stakeholder expectations, and legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements - surrounding the organization's cybersecurity risk management decisions are understood (formerly ID.BE)
column5: GV.OC-02: Internal and external stakeholders are determined, and their needs and expectations regarding cybersecurity risk management are understood

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Organizational Context (GV.OC): The circumstances - mission, stakeholder expectations, and legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements - surrounding the organization's cybersecurity risk management decisions are understood (formerly ID.BE)
column5: GV.OC-03: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding cybersecurity - including privacy and civil liberties obligations - are understood and managed (formerly ID.GV-03)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Organizational Context (GV.OC): The circumstances - mission, stakeholder expectations, and legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements - surrounding the organization's cybersecurity risk management decisions are understood (formerly ID.BE)
column5: GV.OC-04: Critical objectives, capabilities, and services that stakeholders depend on or expect from the organization are determined and communicated (formerly ID.BE-04, ID.BE-05)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Organizational Context (GV.OC): The circumstances - mission, stakeholder expectations, and legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements - surrounding the organization's cybersecurity risk management decisions are understood (formerly ID.BE)
column5: GV.OC-05: Outcomes, capabilities, and services that the organization depends on are determined and communicated (formerly ID.BE-01, ID.BE-04)

column2: GOVERN
column3: Risk Management Strategy
column5: GV.RM

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Risk Management Strategy (GV.RM): The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerance and appetite statements, and assumptions are established, communicated, and used to support operational risk decisions (formerly ID.RM)
column5: GV.RM-01: Risk management objectives are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders (formerly ID.RM-01)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Risk Management Strategy (GV.RM): The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerance and appetite statements, and assumptions are established, communicated, and used to support operational risk decisions (formerly ID.RM)
column5: GV.RM-02: Risk appetite and risk tolerance statements are determined, communicated, and maintained (formerly ID.RM-02, ID.RM-03)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Risk Management Strategy (GV.RM): The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerance and appetite statements, and assumptions are established, communicated, and used to support operational risk decisions (formerly ID.RM)
column5: GV.RM-03: Enterprise risk management processes include cybersecurity risk management activities and outcomes (formerly ID.GV-04)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Risk Management Strategy (GV.RM): The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerance and appetite statements, and assumptions are established, communicated, and used to support operational risk decisions (formerly ID.RM)
column5: GV.RM-04: Strategic direction that describes appropriate risk response options is established and communicated

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Risk Management Strategy (GV.RM): The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerance and appetite statements, and assumptions are established, communicated, and used to support operational risk decisions (formerly ID.RM)
column5: GV.RM-05: Lines of communication across the organization are established for cybersecurity risks, including risks from suppliers and other third parties

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Risk Management Strategy (GV.RM): The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerance and appetite statements, and assumptions are established, communicated, and used to support operational risk decisions (formerly ID.RM)
column5: GV.RM-06: A standardized method for calculating, documenting, categorizing, and prioritizing cybersecurity risks is established and communicated

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Risk Management Strategy (GV.RM): The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerance and appetite statements, and assumptions are established, communicated, and used to support operational risk decisions (formerly ID.RM)
column5: GV.RM-07: Strategic opportunities (i.e., positive risks) are identified and included in organizational cybersecurity risk discussions

column2: GOVERN
column3: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management (GV.SC): Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders (formerly ID.SC)
column5: GV.SC-01: A cybersecurity supply chain risk management program, strategy, objectives, policies, and processes are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders (formerly ID.SC-01)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management (GV.SC): Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders (formerly ID.SC)
column5: GV.SC-02: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for suppliers, customers, and partners are established, communicated, and coordinated internally and externally (formerly ID.AM-06)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management (GV.SC): Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders (formerly ID.SC)
column5: GV.SC-03: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management is integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management, risk assessment, and improvement processes (formerly ID.SC-02)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management (GV.SC): Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders (formerly ID.SC)
column5: GV.SC-04: Suppliers are known and prioritized by criticality

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management (GV.SC): Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders (formerly ID.SC)
column5: GV.SC-05: Requirements to address cybersecurity risks in supply chains are established, prioritized, and integrated into contracts and other types of agreements with suppliers and other relevant third parties (formerly ID.SC-03)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management (GV.SC): Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders (formerly ID.SC)
column5: GV.SC-06: Planning and due diligence are performed to reduce risks before entering into formal supplier or other third-party relationships

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management (GV.SC): Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders (formerly ID.SC)
column5: GV.SC-07: The risks posed by a supplier, their products and services, and other third parties are identified, recorded, prioritized, assessed, responded to, and monitored over the course of the relationship (formerly ID.SC-02, ID.SC-04)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management (GV.SC): Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders (formerly ID.SC)
column5: GV.SC-08: Relevant suppliers and other third parties are included in incident planning, response, and recovery activities (formerly ID.SC-05)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management (GV.SC): Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders (formerly ID.SC)
column5: GV.SC-09: Supply chain security practices are integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management programs, and their performance is monitored throughout the technology product and service life cycle

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management (GV.SC): Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders (formerly ID.SC)
column5: GV.SC-10: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management plans include provisions for activities that occur after the conclusion of a partnership or service agreement

column2: GOVERN
column3: Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities (GV.RR): Cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and authorities to foster accountability, performance assessment, and continuous improvement are established and communicated (formerly ID.GV-02)
column5: GV.RR-01: Organizational leadership is responsible and accountable for cybersecurity risk and fosters a culture that is risk-aware, ethical, and continually improving

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities (GV.RR): Cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and authorities to foster accountability, performance assessment, and continuous improvement are established and communicated (formerly ID.GV-02)
column5: GV.RR-02: Roles, responsibilities, and authorities related to cybersecurity risk management are established, communicated, understood, and enforced (formerly ID.AM-06, ID.GV-02, DE.DP-01)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities (GV.RR): Cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and authorities to foster accountability, performance assessment, and continuous improvement are established and communicated (formerly ID.GV-02)
column5: GV.RR-03: Adequate resources are allocated commensurate with cybersecurity risk strategy, roles and responsibilities, and policies

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities (GV.RR): Cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and authorities to foster accountability, performance assessment, and continuous improvement are established and communicated (formerly ID.GV-02)
column5: GV.RR-04: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices (formerly PR.IP-11)

column2: GOVERN
column3: Policies, Processes, and Procedures

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Policies, Processes, and Procedures (GV.PO): Organizational cybersecurity policies, processes, and procedures are established, communicated, and enforced (formerly ID.GV-01)
column5: GV.PO-01: Policies, processes, and procedures for managing cybersecurity risks are established based on organizational context, cybersecurity strategy, and priorities and are communicated and enforced (formerly ID.GV-01)

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Policies, Processes, and Procedures (GV.PO): Organizational cybersecurity policies, processes, and procedures are established, communicated, and enforced (formerly ID.GV-01)
column5: GV.PO-02: Policies, processes, and procedures for managing cybersecurity risks are reviewed, updated, communicated, and enforced to reflect changes in requirements, threats, technology, and organizational mission (formerly ID.GV-01)

column2: GOVERN
column3: Oversight

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Oversight (GV.OV): Results of organization-wide cybersecurity risk management activities and performance are used to inform, improve, and adjust the risk management strategy
column5: GV.OV-01: Cybersecurity risk management strategy outcomes are reviewed to inform and adjust strategy and direction

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Oversight (GV.OV): Results of organization-wide cybersecurity risk management activities and performance are used to inform, improve, and adjust the risk management strategy
column5: GV.OV-02: The cybersecurity risk management strategy is reviewed and adjusted to ensure coverage of organizational requirements and risks

column2: GOVERN (GV): Establish and monitor the organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy
column3: Oversight (GV.OV): Results of organization-wide cybersecurity risk management activities and performance are used to inform, improve, and adjust the risk management strategy
column5: GV.OV-03: Organizational cybersecurity risk management performance is measured and reviewed to confirm and adjust strategic direction

IDENTIFY

column5: ID.AM-01: Inventories of hardware managed by the organization are maintained

column2: 3-PROTECT
PROTECT
column3: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control (PR.AA): Access to physical and logical assets is limited to authorized users, services, and hardware, and is managed commensurate with the assessed risk of unauthorized access (formerly PR.AC)
column5: PR.AA-01: Identities and credentials for authorized users, services, and hardware are managed by the organization (formerly PR.AC-01)

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control (PR.AA): Access to physical and logical assets is limited to authorized users, services, and hardware, and is managed commensurate with the assessed risk of unauthorized access (formerly PR.AC)
column5: PR.AA-02: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials based on the context of interactions (formerly PR.AC-06)

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control (PR.AA): Access to physical and logical assets is limited to authorized users, services, and hardware, and is managed commensurate with the assessed risk of unauthorized access (formerly PR.AC)
column5: PR.AA-03: Users, services, and hardware are authenticated (formerly PR.AC-03, PR.AC-07)

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control (PR.AA): Access to physical and logical assets is limited to authorized users, services, and hardware, and is managed commensurate with the assessed risk of unauthorized access (formerly PR.AC)
column5: PR.AA-04: Identity assertions are protected, conveyed, and verified

column3: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control (PR.AA): Access to physical and logical assets is limited to authorized users, services, and hardware, and is managed commensurate with the assessed risk of unauthorized access (formerly PR.AC)
column5: PR.AA-05: Access permissions, entitlements, and authorizations are defined in a policy, managed, enforced, and reviewed, and incorporate the principles of least privilege and separation of duties (formerly PR.AC-01, PR.AC-03, PR.AC-04)

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control (PR.AA): Access to physical and logical assets is limited to authorized users, services, and hardware, and is managed commensurate with the assessed risk of unauthorized access (formerly PR.AC)
column5: PR.AA-06: Physical access to assets is managed, monitored, and enforced commensurate with risk (formerly PR.AC-02, PR.PT-04)

column2: PROTECT
column3: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control

column2: PROTECT
column3: Awareness and Training

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Awareness and Training (PR.AT): The organization's personnel are provided cybersecurity awareness and training so they can perform their cybersecurity-related tasks
column5: PR.AT-01: Users are provided awareness and training so they possess the knowledge and skills to perform general tasks with security risks in mind (formerly PR.AT-01, PR.AT-03, RS.CO-01)

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Awareness and Training (PR.AT): The organization's personnel are provided cybersecurity awareness and training so they can perform their cybersecurity-related tasks
column5: PR.AT-02: Individuals in specialized roles are provided awareness and training so they possess the knowledge and skills to perform relevant tasks with security risks in mind (formerly PR.AT-02, PR.AT-03, PR.AT-04, PR.AT-05)

column2: PROTECT
column3: Data Security

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information
column5: PR.DS-01: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-at-rest are protected (formerly PR.DS-01, PR-DS.05, PR.DS-06, PR.PT-02)

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information
column5: PR.DS-02: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-transit are protected (formerly PR.DS-02, PR.DS-05)

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information
column5: PR.DS-09: Data is managed throughout its life cycle, including destruction (formerly PR.IP-06)

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information
column5: PR.DS-10: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-use are protected (formerly PR.DS-05)

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Data Security (PR.DS): Data is managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information
column5: PR.DS-11: Backups of data are created, protected, maintained, and tested (formerly PR.IP-04)

column5: PR.PS-04: Log records are generated and made available for continuous monitoring (formerly PR.PT-01)

column3: Platform Security (PR.PS): The hardware, software (e.g., firmware, operating systems, applications), and services of physical and virtual platforms are managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect their confidentiality, integrity, and availability

column2: PROTECT
column3: Technology Infrastructure Resilience

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Technology Infrastructure Resilience (PR.IR): Security architectures are managed with the organization's risk strategy to protect asset confidentiality, integrity, and availability, and organizational resilience
column5: PR.IR-01: Networks and environments are protected from unauthorized logical access and usage (formerly PR.AC-03, PR.AC-05, PR.DS-07, PR.PT-04)

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Technology Infrastructure Resilience (PR.IR): Security architectures are managed with the organization's risk strategy to protect asset confidentiality, integrity, and availability, and organizational resilience
column5: PR.IR-02: The organization's technology assets are protected from environmental threats (formerly PR.IP-05)

column3: Technology Infrastructure Resilience (PR.IR): Security architectures are managed with the organization's risk strategy to protect asset confidentiality, integrity, and availability, and organizational resilience
column5: PR.IR-03: Mechanisms are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations (formerly PR.PT-05)

column2: PROTECT (PR): Use safeguards to prevent or reduce cybersecurity risk
column3: Technology Infrastructure Resilience (PR.IR): Security architectures are managed with the organization's risk strategy to protect asset confidentiality, integrity, and availability, and organizational resilience
column5: PR.IR-04: Adequate resource capacity to ensure availability is maintained (formerly PR.DS-04)

column2: 4-DETECT
DETECT
column3: Continuous Monitoring

column2: DETECT (DE): Find and analyze possible cybersecurity attacks and compromises
column3: Continuous Monitoring (DE.CM): Assets are monitored to find anomalies, indicators of compromise, and other potentially adverse events

column2: 5-RESPOND

column3: Response Planning

column2: RESPOND
column3: Incident Management

column2: RESPOND (RS): Take action regarding a detected cybersecurity incident

column2: RESPOND (RS): Take action regarding a detected cybersecurity incident
column3: Incident Management (RS.MA): Responses to detected cybersecurity incidents are managed (formerly RS.RP)

column3: Incident Management (RS.MA): Responses to detected cybersecurity incidents are managed (formerly RS.RP)

column3: Incident Management (RS.MA): Responses to detected cybersecurity incidents are managed (formerly RS.RP)
column5: RS.MA-04: Incidents are escalated or elevated as needed (formerly RS.AN-02, RS.CO-04)

column2: RESPOND (RS): Take action regarding a detected cybersecurity incident
column3: Incident Management (RS.MA): Responses to detected cybersecurity incidents are managed (formerly RS.RP)

column2: 6-RECOVER
RECOVER
column3: Incident Recovery Plan Execution

column2: RECOVER (RC): Restore assets and operations that were impacted by a cybersecurity incident
column3: Incident Recovery Plan Execution (RC.RP): Restoration activities are performed to ensure operational availability of systems and services affected by cybersecurity incidents
column5: RC.RP-01: The recovery portion of the incident response plan is executed once initiated from the incident response process

column2: RECOVER (RC): Restore assets and operations that were impacted by a cybersecurity incident
column3: Incident Recovery Plan Execution (RC.RP): Restoration activities are performed to ensure operational availability of systems and services affected by cybersecurity incidents
column5: RC.RP-02: Recovery actions are determined, scoped, prioritized, and performed

column2: RECOVER (RC): Restore assets and operations that were impacted by a cybersecurity incident
column3: Incident Recovery Plan Execution (RC.RP): Restoration activities are performed to ensure operational availability of systems and services affected by cybersecurity incidents
column5: RC.RP-03: The integrity of backups and other restoration assets is verified before using them for restoration

column2: RECOVER (RC): Restore assets and operations that were impacted by a cybersecurity incident
column3: Incident Recovery Plan Execution (RC.RP): Restoration activities are performed to ensure operational availability of systems and services affected by cybersecurity incidents
column5: RC.RP-04: Critical mission functions and cybersecurity risk management are considered to establish post-incident operational norms

column2: RECOVER (RC): Restore assets and operations that were impacted by a cybersecurity incident
column3: Incident Recovery Plan Execution (RC.RP): Restoration activities are performed to ensure operational availability of systems and services affected by cybersecurity incidents
column5: RC.RP-05: The integrity of restored assets is verified, systems and services are restored, and normal operating status is confirmed

column2: RECOVER (RC): Restore assets and operations that were impacted by a cybersecurity incident

column5: RC.RP-06: The criteria for determining the end of incident recovery are applied, and incident-related documentation is completed
